question: You mentioned PayPal's early adoption of public bug bounty programs; could you elaborate on how that experience has influenced your current approach to integrating crowdsourced security into product management?

inputs.question: You mentioned PayPal's early adoption of public bug bounty programs; could you elaborate on how that experience has influenced your current approach to integrating crowdsourced security into product management?

conversationHistory.content: Can you please share your background and your role at your current organization?

"My current role is a Senior Manager of Product Management. My background is in engineering and product management with a focus on security. I spent several years working in security-related roles at Magento, an e-commerce company acquired by PayPal, eBay, and later by Adobe. At those companies, I worked directly on crowdsourced security. PayPal was one of the very first companies to have a public bug bounty program."

questions: Reflecting on your time at PayPal, how did your early exposure to public bug bounty programs shape your view on utilizing crowdsourced security?
In what ways did your experience with PayPal’s pioneering bug bounty initiative influence your current approach to integrating crowdsourced security into product management?
Can you identify specific elements from your work with PayPal’s public bug bounty program that now guide your strategy for incorporating crowdsourced security in your products?
